story:
Short Description


This story is about I've made it so far with my dream to become a dancer and how the financial situation in Greece over the past years has made it difficult for me to see it through.

The Story


Dear Contributors

Thank you for taking the time to look into my campaign. I hope I'll make it worth your while :)
I currently live in Greece, where I shan't be staying for much longer, as it's nearly impossible to find a job that would start my a life, let alone the career of my dreams. 
Before I do that though, there's one last thing I need to do & that's complete my ballet training. If I manage to exploit the 8 upcoming months, I shall collect the ultimate certification for ballet dancing skill by the Royal Academy of Dance. Plus, I'll also get to keep the actual dancing skill itself... :) 
Having this certification (and the skill that should come with it) I'll be in the position not only to dance better, but also to teach dance and support myself doing something I love. 
Dancing is what I've been doing my entire life & having survived financial struggles in the past I find it impossible to give up hope now that I've come this far. Especially since tuition fees at my dance school are so low that it becomes a crime keeping out of such a life benefit.
My family is not in the position to help me, either. My dad is a cab driver, barely making enough to support the four of us without any luxuries. 
For the past 4 years God, the Spirits, & the Universe have made it so, that short-term job opportunities came out of the blue and helped me cover all tuition expenses. I worked as a care taker of a special needs child,  a private tutor of English to children & adults, and a tutor of Greek as well. I've been a secretary at a dance school and a columnist in a website, too. All of these job opportunities came from nowhere, & i believe them to have been divine intervention helping me realize my dream. 
This year, however, I start with zero savings, a 900euro debt & not a job opportunity to be seen. Not even one of those offering 3 euros per hour... When it comes down to it, all I need is another divine intervention. And, as I've learned it always comes from the place you least expect it. I've sent Cvs all over, and I've posted work ads on the streets, & in shops. I've built a good number of professional profiles, & I've put the word around, giving professional cards. I have done everything I could think of, & it somehow got that I'm doing this now, too. 
I need 800 euros, out of which 500 will cover full tuition for 8 months, the 200 will cover exam fees going to Royal Academy and 100 will go for ballet shoes. Transportation is still a cost for unemployed people in my city, and ballet shoes will definitely call for more expenses than listed, but i'm hopeful I'll be able to get this myself...
For whoever knows astrology, I'm a Pisces, Scorpio rising. This means I'm a dreamer in the armor of a warrior. I dream big and I have all necessary determination & drive to do all it takes to make my dream come true. In the process I like to encourage and inspire others to do the same. I believe pursuing dreams does a lot for a person's soul, while it helps us maintain healthy relationships with the people in our lives too!
If the funds don't reach the entire amount I've set, they will still add to the same exact end goal, if I have to die!! I haven't been spending in drinks, or meals, or nights out in never!! I'm not about to now... And it's all been to make me the kind of great artist I want to be, so I'll make it happen with as much help as I can get!

The impact

This project is valuable to the contributor, because it comes from my heart. I see it as part of a larger scheme that promotes beauty and love in this world. I don't believe I'm naive in wanting to achieve something that seems out of reach right now. Having the instinct to pursue something seemingly unreachable is my divine path and obligation. I don't think I ever had a choice & I don't believe there's an escape. Sometimes i wish there was...
But I see all the people that have dreamed of something with the same intensity and self-denial as me, & they're the best I know!! They're the only people I know willing to give all they have unconditionally, and, to a great extent, they're the ones who helped me be a better me. Even more so than my parents in many cases!
I believe the world needs more of those people, and I want to be one of them too. But in order to give the best I have, I need to have the best in my very hands, and I need help to do that. And though never before have I campaigned for money, these great artists in my life have definitely taught me sponsorship. 
My determination once caught the eye of a dear friend who started giving me vocal lessons for free. It, then, caught the eye of an old singing teacher who ran a long lasting career as an opera singer in worldwide scale. I've had financial conveniences from both of them with occasional free classes, or very small payments. I've also managed to get a degree in Harmony, for very small tuition, since another good friend gave me free theory and piano lessons, too... Essentially, I've always been a moving campaign, even if sometimes it didn't arrive by command...
Still, dancing seems like something I cannot do for free right now, & though music is my heart and soul, dancing is too! And I do not want to give up on any one of my loves, especially when I'm so close to making it fly! 
If you are a person who can help in some small way, please don't let a love die, because of a temporary barrier. Love is always a two way street, and I ensure my success will always be about giving back to people the help, inspiration and support I got from people. It's all I sing and dance for...

Risks & Challenges 

As far as dance is concerned my #1 challenge has always been my difficult body. I'm not naturally flexible, I have bumpy knees & not a hint of curve on my arches. Yet, I've passed previous exams quite successfully, despite my physical limitations. My view is, if I can win a battle against my nature, I can win any battle. Money is just a medium necessary to do things. If nature is not a limitation, then money certainly isn't either. 

This is why, fundraising is only one of the steps I'm taking in breaking this limitation. I'm simply looking for help in any place i can find it, and I wish whoever decides to help it's because I truly inspired them in some considerable way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you happen to be Greek, or have Greek connections or just like to give a view in articles you can't understand, find me in https://twitter.com/Silvergirl678, or,  https://www.facebook.com/sophia.chatziriga , add me, and be sure to click on my posts!! If the articles I post gain good readership, writing might actually turn into a source of income. Eventually... 

Be sure to use Indiegogo share tools!

If you happen to be Greek, or have Greek connections or just like to give a view in articles you can't understand, find me in https://twitter.com/Silvergirl678, or,  https://www.facebook.com/sophia.chatziriga , add me, and be sure to click on my posts!! If the articles I post gain good readership, writing might actually turn into a source of income. Eventually... 
Be sure to use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi!  It's Diana, Maria and Sandra!  Back by popular demand, after two straight years of sold-out, standing room only performances, THE LATINA CHRISTMAS SPECIAL (LCS) returns bursting with more laughs, music, escandalo (scandal) and way more shows at a beautiful state of the art theater in downtown LA!

LCS is a play where in itself are 3 original mini-one-woman shows.  3 great friends have a holiday season get-together and naturally the conversation turns to childhood "Christmas Dramas."

THE INDIEGOGO THING IS:  We need some help to supplement the theater's marketing and advertising budget.  We will be hiring an awesome publicist to get the word out to the media and to pay for this little thing he calls, ADVERTISING.  Fancy that!

PLEASE NOTE!  If you are considering donating $1000 or more and would like a tax deductible receipt please donate directly to our producers, The Latino Theater Company - (213) 489-0994, ext. 108.   They are a not-for-profit 501c and tell them you want your donation to go towards THE LATINA CHRISTMAS SPECIAL. They will provide you with a receipt that is yes, tax deductible!   You still get the perks but you must donate to them direct for the tax write-off goodie!

Contribute and be part of empowering your friends - who happen to be women... and Latinas... and more!

  • PR & ADVERTISING:  We need $7000 dollars to mount a reasonably sized PR & Advertising campaign so we can get the big critics in and sell the 22 shows we are doing.  
  • REVIEWS: Critics loving your show is like tamales made of gold.  You make enough of them, you can open a restaurant called "Broadway!"
  • CREATE AWARENESS: Also, we want to raise the profile of THE LATINA CHRISTMAS SPECIAL so that in the years to come we can develop other actors and stories.  

  • PERKS: We have some lovely perks to choose from. Check 'em out!
  • EMPOWERING DIVERSITY:  By helping to make this show a success, you are directly contributing to empowering diversity. 
  • WE ARE HERE FOR YOU: We know you and we appreciate you.  We never forget a friend.
 

We are Latina writers & performers

Diana Yanez
www.dianayanez.com

Maria Russell
www.mariaannrussell.com

Sandra Valls
www.welovesandra.com

The Latina Christmas Special for 2015 is

Directed by
Geoffrey Rivas

Produced by:  The Latino Theater Company
at the

Any help you can afford to give us is deeply and personally appreciated!

  • SOCIAL MEDIA: Do the "El Grito" (the scream) and make some noise about our campaign! 
  • BUY TIX: Please come to our show and have fun with us! Buy tix here: http://thelatc.org/upcoming-shows/the-latina-christmas-special/
  • BRING A GROUP: There are group rates for the show.  You can call the LATC directly at: (213) 489-0994 for the specials.  You can even buy the whole night for your own  party with the cast! 
  • INTRODUCE US TO YOUR RICH FRIENDS!
  • CALL IN FAVORS FROM YOUR CELEBRITY FRIENDS!  One good word to their fans and we are funded!  

Make THE LATINA CHRISTMAS SPECIAL a new holiday tradition.

Please contribute!
Peace, health, love, happiness, hope and best wishes to you for the holidays. 
Paz, salud, amor, alegria, esperanza y mejores deseos para estas fiestas navideñas.
Love,
Diana, Maria, and Sandra
XO
PS - Questions?  Contact us below via social media. :)

story:
Hear Your Heart Beat; "Follow Your Heart"

A Middle Eastern story that comes from the heart

Who we Are:

Evolution Dance Theatre (aka EDT) is a Canadian federally registered not-for-profit company that develops, promotes and performs original Middle Eastern inspired multimedia and multidisciplinary spectacles. Founded by Artistic and Executive Director, Armineh Keshishian, the stories entertain and provoke dialogue on social, spiritual and humanistic themes that have universal appeal. The core values are Unity, Universality and Integrity. To find out more visit our website here.

For Keshishian, dance is an outlet that has allowed her to celebrate her life journey and foster greater understanding of complex cultural issues. Finding her way to the stage, Keshishian’s passion for dance and performance began as a young child and has grown into an extensive performing and choreographic career spanning more than twenty years. Additionally, Keshishian brings the discipline and skills she practices daily in her professional life as a Certified Financial Planner to her role as the visionary behind the multimedia productions she has created and produced.

“My work is influenced by the context of my upbringing; I was born Christian and raised in a Muslim country and this has given me an insight into these two different worlds, of what is allowed and what is not. Because I did not want to follow the traditional rules and regulations as a socially obliging Middle Eastern girl I went on to find my path as an artist and as a woman who can express herself” says Keshishian. She adds; “I strive to create cultural fusion through art. I like to tell current Middle Eastern stories that have universal appeal. My aim is to bring people and cultures together by focusing on our commonalities vs. our differences.”

Our Current Production:

Follow Your Heart is about a modern Middle Eastern woman, Almaza, who is in love with a traditional man, Jivan.  Their love is irresistible, yet doomed as he is bound by tradition and his culture. It is a journey of a woman who fights for love against all odds, against her culture and traditions. What starts as a love story of taboo and tradition in Toronto travels to Middle East and back again, to end up in a world where other cultures and traditions join in to help their love prevail. 

This story showcases a fusion of global heritage, and yet allows you to experience the real Middle Eastern culture; one that is so mysterious to many of the Western world. It questions traditional values, matriarchal archetypes, hidden motifs and desires.  It unveils love, power, suppression and desire!

Where We Are:

Evolution Dance Theatre has grown into a diverse, talented and passionate team of professionals from Toronto and around the world. We’re in the final stages of Follow Your Heart, our largest and most compelling production to date with a cast, crew and design team of over 48 professionals from the fields of dance, music, theatre and digital media. To maintain a high-quality, genuine representation of culture, EDT relies on the skills, experiences and the artists’ ability to collaborate with multiple cultures and multimedia elements to deliver the show and support the goals of the not-for-profit company.

What We Need:

We’re thrilled at the chance to present Follow Your Heart however; there are substantial financial challenges to overcome to bring a production of this magnitude to the stage. By reaching our goal, we will be able to afford the resources necessary to complete the show such as:

- Rehearsal space rental

- Show venue rental

- Fees for cast, crew and directors

- Lodging and Travel for global talent

- Digital Design

- Additional costumes

To extend our gratitude for your donation we have a wide-range of exclusive perks/incentives such as a Downloadable Poster signed by the Executive Artistic Director, Special mentions in our Newsletter, Show Program and Website, VIP Tickets to the show, Backstage Passes, Lunch or Dinner with the Main Cast and Directors and even a Limo Ride for you and your guests near the venue as appreciation for a generous donation!

The Significance of Our Project:

Follow Your Heart is a unique opportunity for artists and multicultural professionals to have a presence on one stage through freedom of expression. It is an example of how we as humans can come together through diversity and thrive in it; creating something better for our world as a result. It also showcases the elements that have made Toronto one of the most multicultural and flourishing communities in the world.

Keshishian notes:

“I have a deep desire for cultural interchange. I am inspired by concepts of women’s empowerment, diversity, multiculturalism and breaking down archetypal traditions. The emotion evoked in me by fusing cultures and dance forms is a sense of peace and belonging.” I aim to have the artists and the audience to look at this work differently instead of from a confined experience.

With your contribution, you can help to bring our core message and the story of Follow Your Heart to life.

Risks, Challenges and How We Plan to Overcome Them All:

As the show Follow Your Heart has been workshopped in the past, some artistic and technical challenges were discovered and addressed.  The script has been revised by our dramaturge and the choreographies have been scrutinized. Now the show is ready to be rehearsed and the choreographies to be designed and implemented.

Currently, Evolution Dance Theatre has a diverse range of board members and is helmed by skilled, knowledgeable and passionate people who are ready to ensure the mandate of the company is carried out as intended under the direction of Keshishian.

With the expertise and solid commitment of Keshishian, EDT has produced and brought to the stage 4 successful Middle Eastern-inspired shows in Toronto since 2006. Furthermore, Keshishian’s personal experience with art and the traditions of the Middle East adds authenticity to the show and her career in finance has provided the fiduciary skills and discipline needed to present a successful dance theatre production.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Aside from financial contributions, there are many ways you can help bring Follow Your Heart to the stage.

Donate – We have a wide range of exclusive perks/incentives as seen above on this page that make great incentives for your financial contribution. 

Social Media - Spread the word to everybody you know that will be interested in supporting Middle Eastern culture, women’s empowerment, universal equality, multicultural collaboration and the power of the arts in dance, music and theatre. Find us on:        Facebook      |       Twitter       |       Instagram       |       Pinterest         

Subscribe – Subscribe to our newsletter to stay informed of our progress on the show and other related news and events. You can find the form on the left side of the page here.

Become a Volunteer - Share your established creative talents as a volunteer in departments such as Hair and Makeup, Wardrobe and Production Assistance. Find out more here.

story:
Renaissance takes Manhattan!

Ever dream of being a  Broadway Producer?!  Well, Here's your chance!

This August 5th (That's right! Less than a month away!) Renaissance Theaterworks is producing  the world premiere of LUCKY NUMBERS, a powerful new play by Gwendolyn Rice for Samuel French's prestigious Off Off Broadway Short Play Festival in NEW YORK CITY! 

Okay...So this is your chance to be an Off Off Broadway producer.

This is a BIG flippin' DEAL!

The Off Off Broadway Festival (OOB), Manhattan's oldest continuous short play festival, features  work from the freshest playwrights in the country.  Hugely popular, the Festival has launched the careers of many major contemporary dramatists, including such notables as Theresa Rebeck, Steve Yockey, and Rachel Bonds. We are thrilled to be included.

This year, the festival received over 1500 submissions  from more than six countries - the largest submission pool ever! From those 1500 plays the Final 30  were chosen as semi-finalists in the 2015 40th Anniversary OOB Festival. Our play, LUCKY NUMBERS made it to the Final 30. The Final 30  plays are performed over 4 nights at the East 13th Street Theater in NYC. At the end of the week, 6 winning plays are chosen for Samuel French representation and publication.  We want to win!

Many of you will remember Gwen's fascinating play, THE GRIOTS, presented last year at RTW inaugural Br!NK program. LUCKY NUMBERS is another compelling piece; a touching drama about an actuary who begins to doubt the power of statistics and mathematical probability as he and his wife prepare for the birth of their first child. Neither of them could have predicted how the pregnancy will change their lives forever. We believe LUCKY NUMBERS can win, and we need Producers to make it happen.

As a Producer your gift will help us support an important emerging Wisconsin playwright as she takes the national stage.


What We Need

We need to transport eight people to NYC and back (four actors, director, stage manager, producer and Br!NK Artistic Associate) and house them in NYC for a week (Yikes! Have you seen the cost of hotels there?).  And we would really love to pay our artists a small stipend.
Our fabulous cast includes Milwaukee favorites:

  • Linnea Koeppel
  • Julie Swenson
  • Emily Vitrano
  • Ken T. Williams
This is a full two-week commitment for all involved; One week rehearsing in Milwaukee and one week performing in NYC. 

What your Producing dollars do:

  • $100 covers all of the props
  • $500 covers one artists' stipend
  • $1,000 covers group meals & groceries
  • $3,000 covers the total airfare costs from MKE - NYC
  • $7,000 underwrites the housing
  • $15,000 Be our Executive Producer and underwrite the whole thing! 

The Impact

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to showcase our world-class theater and the work of an important emerging playwright on a major national stage.  And who knows what lies in store for us after this. 

As our Producer for LUCKY NUMBERS your support will:

  • Launch a Wisconsin playwright Off Off Broadway
  • Help Renaissance expand opportunities for Midwestern female playwrights
  • Help us grow our Br!NK festival.

Since we saw her last August at the world premiere of her play THE GRIOTS for our inaugural Br!NK program,  Gwen Rice's career has taken off!   Here's what she's been up to:

  • Contributing playwright to THE SUITCASE DREAMS, a devised piece by Theatre LILA performed at the Overture Center in Madison, October 2014
  • THE SUITCASE DREAMS will also be performed at the American High School Theatre Festival/The Edinburgh Festival Fringe in Scotland, August 2015
  • Original piece “Shaken, Not Stirred” selected as part of the Walking the Wire Monologue Festival, March 2015
  • Taught an “Introduction to Playwriting” course through Children’s Theater of Madison, Spring 2015
  • Featured playwright at the Great Plains Theater Conference in Omaha, NE, May, 2015

LUCKY NUMBERS playwright, Wisconsinite, & Br!NK winner Gwendolyn Rice

Gwen is an important new voice in American Theater and we are thrilled to help further her work - help us continue to tell women's stories & provide roles for women both onstage & off.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can give, or maybe you want to help us out in other ways as well as donating! Here's what you can do:

  • Spread the word!
  • Find us on Facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to ask others to help as well

All contributions, of any size, help forward our mission and help advance the work of female theater artists. Your contribution is tax deductible.

     Scotland, August 2015

     Children’s Theater of Madison, Spring 2015

     Conference in Omaha, NE, May, 2015

story:
Short Summary

The Muddy Mary Project is a platform for emerging theatre artists. It is a constantly growing initiative with a theme and location that change annually. Seeking to give the stage to the untold and forgotten-about, we are interested in original work, unique stories and diverse perspectives.

The Muddy Mary Project’s ultimate goal is to encourage fellow artists to create, work as a team, and tell stories that need to be told.

This year’s theme is Women Past, Present & Fictional and the location is Toronto, ON.

Information on our debut series, OPIA, can be found below.


What We Need & Why We Need It

You know that phrase "make your own luck?" Well, for anyone in the arts, "make your own" kind of just applies to everything. This isn't a complaint. When you piece together your own career, a lot of exciting opportunities arise. Still, starting something from scratch is difficult... and if there are people around who believe in what you're trying to make and want to support it, we've found that the best course of action is always to say thank you and accept the help.

We're asking for $5, $10, $2, $200, 50 cents, etc. from anyone who, like us, believes that theatre is important. Your contribution -- big or small -- will allow us to continue to support emerging theatre artists by providing them with a platform to tell their stories. Because we believe in telling stories. We believe that understanding somebody's point of view or situation is not only entertaining, but important. Theatre promotes understanding, understanding promotes empathy, and empathy promotes compassion.

All funds raised through this campaign directly support the The Muddy Mary Project and our mission, primarily through aiding with production costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in supporting The Muddy Mary Project, but would like to do so in ways other than donating money... thank you! Spreading the word about this campaign and OPIA are great ways to help out.

If you would like to Volunteer as an Usher, Stagehand or anything-else-you-think-could-be-helpful, send an email to Jessica Watkin, Festival Administrator, at jessica@muddymary.ca.
story_txt:
Short Summary 

The Muddy Mary Project is a platform for emerging theatre
artists. It is a constantly growing initiative with a theme and location that
change annually. Seeking to give the stage to the untold and
forgotten-about, we are interested in original work, unique stories and diverse
perspectives. 
The Muddy Mary Project’s ultimate goal is to encourage
fellow artists to create, work as a team, and tell stories that need to be
told. 


This year’s theme is Women Past, Present & Fictional and
the location is Toronto, ON.
Information on our
debut series, OPIA, can be found below.




  What We Need & Why We Need It
 You know that phrase "make your own luck?" Well, for anyone in the arts, "make your own" kind of just applies to everything. This isn't a complaint. When you piece together your own career, a lot of exciting opportunities arise. Still, starting something from scratch is difficult... and if there are people around who believe in what you're trying to make and want to support it, we've found that the best course of action is always to say thank you and accept the help.
We're asking for $5, $10, $2, $200, 50 cents, etc. from anyone who, like us, believes that theatre is important. Your contribution -- big or small -- will allow us to continue to support emerging theatre artists by providing them with a platform to tell their stories. Because we believe in telling stories. We believe that understanding somebody's point of view or situation is not only entertaining, but important. Theatre promotes understanding, understanding promotes empathy, and empathy promotes compassion. 
All funds raised through this campaign directly support the The Muddy Mary Project and our mission, primarily through aiding with production costs.



Other Ways You Can Help


If you're interested in supporting The Muddy Mary Project, but would like to do so in ways other than donating money... thank you! Spreading the word about this campaign and OPIA are great ways to help out. 
If you would like to Volunteer as an Usher, Stagehand or anything-else-you-think-could-be-helpful, send an email to Jessica Watkin, Festival Administrator, at jessica@muddymary.ca.

story:
Derling Dance Arts (DDA) is a not for profit professional performing arts company with a mission to create innovative works that increase the public's knowledge and appreciation of art. DDA was incorporated in 2011 and has since produced over 100 performances of original works and multiple residencies/arts education development programs in the Tri state area.  In 2014, DDA was featured on the PBS channel in a documentary about the theatrical process.  Soon after, the idea for a new work blossomed in a yoga studio where an artistic director and a surf artist had a chance encounter. 

On October 17th, 2015 at Algonquin Arts Theatre in Manasquan New Jersey, Derling Dance Arts is teaming up with renowned painter Jay Alders to premier an evening length work entitled “Fairy Tails”. 

Jay Alders is a fine artist whose distinctive style & imaginative prowess is recognized around the world.  Jay’s work has been featured in Galleries from NYC to California, Art Tours in Brazil, Surf Exhibitions on the North Shore of Oahu and 2008 X-Games. Organizations like Emergen-C, Billabong, Endless Games, Donavon Frankenreiter, Ted Shred’s and Original Longboards all have licensed Jay’s Art for their Internationally distributed Product lines.  In November 2009, Jay was described as “The Artist who is Everywhere” by ESPN because of Jay’s constant globe trotting and impressive industry involvement.  Alders has collaborated and/or toured with talented friends such as: G. Love, Donavon Frankenreiter, Citizen Cope, The Expendables, Matt Costa, ALO, Sean Davey, Mishka, Paula Fuga, Greg Noll, John Butler Trio, Rob Machado and Guns N Roses’ guitarist Ron “Bumblefoot” Thal to name a few. 

DDA is excited for the opportunity to bring Jay Alders surrealist painting “Fairy Tails” to life on stage through dance.  Together, Jay Alders & DDA will tackle issues of marriage equality, gay rights and unification of science and religious thought through a visual/choreographic narrative.  Find out how the Fibonacci sequence and the Golden Ratio helped create this oil painting. 

Why we need your help?  Derling Dance Arts is a section 501©3 tax-exempt organization that greatly depends on the generous support from donors like you to sustain our positive influential programs.  This performance will be a HUGE undertaking for the company due to the many expenses of running a high concept production, however the influential benefits from experiencing a one of a kind show like this are priceless.  PLEASE support us in bringing love and light everywhere.  Any amount is appreciated and will all go to support an amazing cause! 

See you at the show!

10/17/15 8:00pm

“Fairy Tails”

Algonquin Arts Theatre

Manasquan, NJ

Tickets & Box Office
(732) 528-9211

boxoffice@algonquinarts.org

derlingdancearts@gmail.com

story:
Take a peek

Take a look at our past successful event to get you ready for what's coming up next. Take a look here. https://youtu.be/ApYUChEbajg

Short and Sweet

Have you ever wanted to explore your sensual side but afraid to show it! Do you want to dip into your inner fantasies while still concealing your identity until you break out of your shell? Or are you cautious to bring out your sexy inner Adonis and Goddesses! Don't worry, Keep Calm and Masquerade On at Aphrodite INK's Masquerade Party and showcase who you really are.

Indulge yourself at our fantasy costume and masquerade party with people like yourself. Enjoy performances, food, pictures, and more. 

Who we are

We are Aphrodite INK, LLC Event Planning and Event Services.

  • Our mission - Creating Creative Events for Creative People.

We want to put on events that allows people that are nervous, shy or afraid of confessing what they are really into or want to try, and can experience an event like no other. We want to make events that people can call a one of a kind truly exceptional experience. Maybe something exotic or strange or liberating, something they can dress up sexy to or seductive; something that’s not their typical norm. 

And what better way than a masquerade. Masquerades allow people to express their inner most desires by parading around as the wild souls they are deep down inside, and allowing them to let their inner goddess out.

Aphrodite INK strives to create events that moves people, leaves them wanting more, waiting to see what we will do next or can come up with. We want to help others create the greatest events of their wildest dreams and we want to share with you our dreams. 

Scratch our Back & We'll Scratch Yours

We are passionate about putting on this masquerade party. Whether it be a masquerade ball with formal gowns and cocktails or if it's a party where costumes are creative, fantasized, extravagant, no matter. How many can say that they've been to a masquerade event for such an inexpensive price and get the same benefits. Speaking of benefits, here's yours.

Benefits

  • Free light food. If you don't like our selection, you can't be too upset because you didn't pay extra, but the cash bar will surely not disappoint. 
  • Do you want to take a selfie! We will have a photographer, or more, photographing every moment, so flag him down and strike a pose. Get access to all the pictures following the event.
  • Did you expect dinner and a movie, well don't worry, we have performances that will certainly entertain.
  • Enough said? Just wait, more to come but depending on the kind support.

The Impact

  • We are a new company motivated by helping people experience one of a kind events that are not your typical Friday night clubs or parties. These events are detail oriented and creative and require a lot of extensive work put into them in order for it to be successful. So the time, patience, and funds it takes to create events like this are on the grand scale.
  • Our events success will be more valuable to you, the contributor and to the world because it will show that you support a passionate business trying to make a difference in the way people enjoy their creative side. A new experience like this will allow you to step out of your comfort zone and try new things that you normally wouldn't. We want you to finally be able to say that you went to a masquerade party without having to pay a fortune to attend.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you cannot attend, the smaller contributions are available and welcomed.
  • Ask friends and family members, neighbors, your hair dresser or whomever you know, to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use texts, email, social media, or whatever you come across to let people know about this campaign, to help support a passionate drive. And you can now use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
Cupcake Campaign

A company of 10 Montreal-based artists--all of whom happen to be women-- have joined forces under the banner of Composite Theatre Co. to bring Marie-Claude Verdier's incisive play Je n'y suis plus to Toronto in a translation entitled I'm Not Here, by award-winning translator and playwright Alexis Diamond. 

I'm Not Here will be presented as part of SummerWorks Performance Festival, August 4-14, 2016. Founded in 1991, SummerWorks Performance Festival is Canada's largest curated performance festival of theatre, dance, music, and live art.  


I'm Not Here: The Story
Winner of Playwrights’ Workshop Montréal’s 2013 Cole Foundation Translation Competition, I’m Not Here tells the story of our struggle to stay afloat when weighed down by the endless bombardment of tragedy, cruelty, superficiality and absurdity in our hyper “interactive” digital age. 
Between her boss’s cupcake schedule and the distractions of life as an urban singleton,  Ariana tells us the story of her life in a torrent of words, describing a daily existence that’s unravelling, sinking and slipping inevitably towards the brutal and unpredictable unknown. 

I'm Not Here @SummerWorks

Directed by the visionary Jen Quinn, Composite Theatre Co. offers Marie-Claude Verdier’s timely tale as a conversation between performer and audience. The multifaceted design team—Sabrina Miller (set and costumes), Stephanie Moore (composition and sound design) and Isabel Quintero Faia (lighting and stage manager)—have created an immersive experience, with the performance unfolding right around the audience. In the intimacy of Toronto’s hub14, audience members are invited to sit in the play space, in an attempt to bring the notion of interactivity full circle, back to the lone storyteller, back to where it all began.

This unique theatrical happening, co-produced by Stefanie Buxton, will be performed by the compelling Shiong-En Chan, Alex Petrachuk and Nadia Verrucci, who also doubles as choreographer. 
Cupcakes and iced tea will be served, free of charge, to the 30 audience members. 

Why We're Here
-We believe in the power of performance.
-We believe in offering our audiences an engaging theatre experience. 
-We believe in serving food (or at least libations) at our shows.
-We believe in paying our artists.
-We believe in durable, sustainable theatre. This principle applies to everything from our marketing materials and programs to props and napkins, cups and saucers, and so on...

I'M NOT HERE: The Magnet. Who needs disposable flyers?(Design: Sabrina Miller) 
What We Need
Given the intimacy of the venue and the small number of seats per show, we are asking those of our supporters and patrons who are not able to attend our Benefit Previews in Montreal or our SummerWorks shows in Toronto to consider making a donation to offset the costs of production, transportation and cupcakes. 
We are asking for $7,000 to cover our shortfall. This means the difference between going broke and breaking even!


Why Support This Cupcake Campaign

-Bring an important play to a new audience. 

-Introduce talented Montreal artists to Toronto.

-Help bridge the gaps between theatre communities in Canada and beyond. 

-Dismantle the silo effect that maintains these gaps between communities by supporting this travelling production. 

-Foster a fresh vision of theatre and live performance. 

We are bringing this show to SummerWorks no matter what. But we'd rather break even doing it. 


CUPCAKE PERKS: The Icing on the Cupcake

$5 = Composite cupcake recipe

$10 = E-mail thank you + social media shoutout  + Composite cupcake recipe

$25 = V-mail thank you + E-mail thank you  + social media shoutout   + Composite cupcake recipe

$50 =  name mentioned during the show  + V-mail thank you + E-mail thank you  + social media shoutout   + Composite cupcake recipe

$100 Cupcake Swag = program/recipe booklet + cupcake-art fridge magnet + name mentioned during the show  + V-mail thank you + E-mail thank you  + social media shoutout   + Composite cupcake recipe

$200 Super Swag = cupcake art print + program/recipe booklet + cupcake-art fridge magnet + name mentioned during the show  + V-mail thank you + E-mail thank you  + social media shoutout   + Composite cupcake recipe

Share the Joy 

If you believe in us, please pass around the cupcakes!

Connect: @SummerWorks  @composite_th
#SW16  #eatmorecupcakes 

Learn more


Photos by Ron Diamond.

Share the Joy 
 If you believe in us, please pass around the cupcakes!

story:
Season 3: Sense and Sensibility

Over the past 3 years Maiden Phoenix has had a mission to tell women's stories and create more opportunity for women in theatre. We have produced 3 full length productions, all of which have had AT LEAST 51% women represented onstage and off. We have helped forward the conversation on gender parity in theater in Boston and we are excited to continue that work this season.
We chose Sense and Sensibility for its classic roots and universality. It explores different kinds of relationships between women- the sort of relationships that can get short changed on stage and screen. The women of SENSE are complicated, hilarious, imperfect, and fully realized. In other words... people! We always strive to show women on stage who are just as interesting, flawed, and honest as the women we encounter every day in our lives and community. These dynamic characters, combined with this incredible new adaptation and our ridiculously creative artistic team, promises to be truly exciting, new, and leave you breathless (at least the cast will be- this play MOVES).
This year we are taking our work to Roxbury, and partnering with Hibernian Hall in Dudley Square, in order to bring this work to a new and under served community. Performance space is always the trickiest part of producing in the Boston area- we are excited to introduce the Boston theatre-going community to a underutilized and beautiful space in the Boston area (if they haven't had a chance to see it already). The single largest expense this campaign will fund is space. We hope that by producing at Hibernian Hall we will inspire other theatre companies to use this venue as well and thus bring more artistic voices to the Roxbury/ Dudley Square community.
The discussion on Gender Parity over the last few years has come a long way- but we can't let it fade. We need to keep striving year after year, season after season, to make sure that women have equal representation onstage and off. MPTC makes it our mission to do just that and encourage other companies to do the same. Lets take this discussion away from our computer screens and out into our community- that is how change happens- and MPTC is proud to be a part of that change.

What We Need

We are asking for $10,000.00 for this production and we want to be very transparent with our contributors about EXACTLY where that money is going.
*We are thrilled to be working with Hibernian Hall in Roxbury, MA for this production:
$2,580.00 will go to Rent for our space
*MPTC is also excited to present the first Boston production of Kate Hamill's new adaptation:
$1,100.00 will go to Rights for the script
* Paying our artists is incredibly important to us. We will never be able to pay our cast, crew, and creative team what they truly deserve, but we make it a priority to pay every one of them and increase our stipends over time;
$4,500.00 will go to stipends for our team
*We are dedicated to giving our Designers the resources they need to create their art:
$1,900 will go to Design budgets
We encourage contributors to let us know which aspect of the production they would like their money to go towards- there are special perks for fully funding any single aspect, such as a specific Artist (like Col. Brandon!) or Budget ( like our Lighting Budget!)

What You Get

Please see our PERKS page for all the goodies you can recieve from your donation!

The Impact

You are supporting women! Local theatre! The Arts! New Plays! Roxbury and Jamaica Plain! The Boston Theatre Scene! Hardworking Artists!
I mean... there is a lot to worry about out there in the world. There are people fighting big fights for representation, equality, civil rights. Supporting art is an expression of how far we have come, what we are fighting for, and how far we still have to go... I won't preach to the choir about why the arts matter- I think you know.

Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash? Share this page and you will help us so much! You can also sign up for our mailing list, or just buy tickets to the show at

 http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2533218

    Other Ways You Can Help Strapped for cash? Share this page and you will help us so much! You can also sign up for our mailing list, or just buy tickets to the show at
 http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2533218

story:
Okay Matthew.

Where we are… This is the grey.

It's in between black and white. Life and death.

Here, now. We are in the grey of life.

And you get to choose what happens next.

Matthew has just killed himself by jumping off Waterloo Bridge. Clara drowned herself on June 2, 1962. They meet in The Grey; the place where people go moments after they've committed suicide.  In The Grey, people make choices, understand their lives and find human connection.  

FALSE CHOICES is the first play written by director Megan Cronin. 

The play is premiering as part of #Festival46 at The King's Head Theatre on Monday 25, Friday 29 & Saturday 30 July 2016.


The Story So Far

Megan Cronin is a theatre director from South East London with a background in verbatim theatre and documentary theatre. FALSE CHOICES is Megan's first play. 

Having developed the script through workshops and scratch readings at Pleasance Theatre Islington, Megan and the FALSE CHOICES team need your help to realise the first full production of this bold new play. 

FALSE CHOICES has been selected to be part of #Festival 46 at The King's Head Theatre in July 2016. #Festival46 is a festival of new work showcasing ambitious and crucial new voices of British Theatre. 


What Your Support Means

We need your help to stage this play. 

Your donation will help us to create the world of FALSE CHOICES; supporting the creative team through the rehearsal period, enabling the design and build of a full set, and paying for a van to move that set from a shed in South-East London to the first full performances of the work at The King's Head Theatre, North London.


Ways To Get Involved

The FALSE CHOICES team would love you to be a part of this project.

Be that making a donation, tweeting us, buying tickets to the show, bringing your mates, dishing out hugs, supplying cups of tea; we are incredibly grateful for your support. 

If you're looking for ideas, below are a few ways to get involved in FALSE CHOICES:

1) BUY TICKETS! 1, 7, 26!? As many as you like, just click here

2) DONATE! Make a donation, big or small, and be showered with gratitude

3) TWEET! Follow us on twitter @FalseChoices

4) FACEBOOK! Like our page www.facebook.com/falsechoices


If you want to get in touch with Megan and the FALSE CHOICES team directly, we would love to hear from you. Email us at megancronindirects@gmail.com

story:
What does this funding cover?

It seems simple, but your donation really does go a long way. In addition to our space, your financial support will cover stipends for our entire staff including technical personnel and performance managers to help our artists get the most out of their experience. You will also help us cover the cost of marketing, both to reach artists from every corner of the city and to build a strong, excited audience to come see them!

Space/Insurance ........... $1,200

Personnel ........................ $1,500

Equipment ......................... $800

Marketing ........................ $1,000

Audience Services ............. $500

What will you get for helping?

We have put together a wonderful assortment of marathon-themed items for you as a token of our immense gratitude. All donors who give more than $10 will be thanked in our Program/Marathon Guide, but there are many more exciting trophies to be had! Various levels of donations could earn you a water bottle, t-shirt, or hoodie! All apparel and items will feature the Chicago Theatre Marathon logo! Plus:

Donations over $50 receive a pair of one-day passes!

Donations over $150 receive a pair of weekend passes!

Donations over $250 receive TWO pairs of weekend passes!!

What is the goal of the Marathon?

We have designed this event wholly with artists in mind.  Your donation allows us to provide a space for artists to try out new work and receive vital audience feedback in the process. There continues to be only limited work and production opportunities for storytellers who do not fit the traditional mold of white, able-bodied, and/or cis-gender male. We hope to address this issue through the power of new work, bringing our community closer together and helping artists be heard.

You can't afford to donate, but you still want to be involved?

You sure can! If you are interested in working with us, either as an artist or in an administrative capacity, please visit www.chicagotheatremarathon.com or e-mail us at info@chicagotheatremarathon.com.

You can also be a big help by spreading the word! Please consider sharing our website with those who you think would want to be involved (and spread this fundraising campaign too if you want!). 

On your marks. 

Get set.

Create!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is luciana achugar. I'm a choreographer who's been making work in New York City and in Uruguay for more than 15 years.

I am currently working on a project called An Epilogue for OTRO TEATRO: True Love. It will be prsesented at Gibney Dance as a co-presentation with The Chocolate Factory on December 10th-12th & 17th-19th at 7:30 pm.

Created and performed by luciana achugar, Oren Barnoy, Peter Jacobs, Shantelle Jackson, Nikima Jagudajev, Jennifer Kjos, Molly Lieber, Michael Mahalchick, Gillian Walsh and Rebecca Wender.  Lighting by Madeline Best. Music by Peter Jacobs. Concept by luciana achugar.

We are doing this for you, for the love we have for this form, for ourselves, for each other,  for this hard life and hard world we're living in. So, we want to share this love with you, it is there and you will feel it  when you come to the show, and I hope you will join us and I can't wait to share it with you!!!

We are in indiegogo because this guarantees that your pledge will reach the artists directly.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm here today to ask for your help to gather enough funds to more fairly compensate this amazing group of collaborators that I've been working with.
They have given themselves to this work with dedication and with love!
Your support will go directly to the 10 collaborators on this project. It will reflect an ethos of fairness in the economy of making. This work more than any other I have made before is almost completely equally authored by my collaborators, especially the dancers, and myself.
You will get a to be part in the making of a new kind of dance that offers healing, love and transformation for the audience. An Epilogue for OTRO TEATRO: True Love is a tribute to our love of Dance, of each other, of the community and the world at large.          (See perks on the side)

The Impact

We have been trying to make this dance in a new way, a way in which our experience, the experience of the dancers, is prioritized, instead of being just tools to make a product to be consumed by a passive audience.

An Epilogue for OTRO TEATRO: True Love offers a different value system that doesn't by posing art as heightened and immersive experience rather than spectacle. With this work, the growth, the transformation and the healing of the performers becomes the work itself. The work is based in a practice that I began developing with my collaborators when I began making OTRO TEATRO in 2013. This is a practice of what I call "growing" ourselves a new body, an uncivilized, decolonized and utopian body; one for ourselves individually, and a collective body. A practice of growing ourselves a collective body between ourselves, and growing a collective body with the audience during the performance. And, in a more ideal greater sense, a practice of growing a collective body with our whole community, and with the whole world.

Risks & Challenges

This new method of working shifts the concept of the role of my collaborators and requires more support. I was fortunate enough to have received a lot of suppport for my previous work, OTRO TEATRO, from Foundations, residencies and two commissioners such as the Walker Art Center and NYLA. However, unfortunately for this project, being a mid-career artist, I was not able to secure as much support as I have in the past and yet I am still committed to continue to work with this incredible group of people who are literally the stuff that this work is made of. SO I could not do it any other way.

While I have received some support for which i am deeply grateful, it is not enough to equally and fairly support my collaborators-- who i feel have co-authored this work and deserve recognition. As my artistic efforts move toward an egalitarian and thoughtful approach to making dances, so does my administrative effort flow-- it is important to me that, despite the challenges, that this work flows forth with integrity and honors the efforts of these beautiful artists.

Thank you very much and much love!
luciana.

Other Ways You Can Help
Come to the show in December:
https://gibneydance.org/performance/making-space-fall-2015/luciana-achugar/
or

Support our Nonprofit  lachugar, inc.  directly at https://mobile.paypal.com/us/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_express-checkout-mobile&useraction=commit&token=EC-0FB6713692210214N#m

story:
WHAT IS PROJET RAD?

Projet RAD is an organization providing people with special needs an opportunity to take inclusive urban dance classes and workshops in a progressive and reliable atmosphere tailored to the needs of each student.  We believe that everyone can reach their full potential and can accomplish any goal, regardless of ability. Guided by certified dance instructors, our students experience the joy of dancing within a group and have the opportunity to shine on stage like superstars!

Projet RAD est une organisation ayant pour mission de donner la chance à des personnes ayant des besoins particuliers de suivre des cours et ateliers inclusifs de danse urbaine dans un environnement chaleureux, sécuritaire et adapté à leurs besoins. Nous croyons que toute personne possède la capacité  d’atteindre son plein potentiel et d’accomplir ses buts, peu importe ses habiletés. Accompagnés par des professeurs certifiés, les élèves pourront partager le plaisir de danser avec un groupe et s’épanouir sur scène telle une “superstar”! 

                


In the Fall of 2012, Projet RAD began their program in a single dance studio in Laval, QC with a total of 6 students. Today, RAD runs their programs in 5 dance studios and 3 schools in the greater Montreal region with over 200 students. We are constantly delighted to hear from parents and students alike the positive and empowering impact of Projet RAD programs.

Au cours de l’automne 2012, Projet RAD a commencé son programme de danse dans un studio de danse situé à Laval, avec un total de 6 élèves. Aujourd’hui, RAD gère son programme dans 5 studios de danse  et 3 écoles dans la grande région de Montréal avec plus de 200 élèves. Nous sommes toujours ravis de constater, grâce aux témoignages de différents parents et élèves, l’impact positif de RAD dans leur vie : nous donnons à nos élèves le pouvoir de croire en leurs habiletés et en eux-mêmes.




WHO WE ARE

We are a young and passionate team of professionals with diverse backgrounds in dance, occupational therapy, and education.  Co-founder and spokesperson, Luca “Lazylegz” Patuelli (world renowned dancer and motivational speaker) represents our philosophy of limitless possibilities. We emphasize the power of adaptation and creativity by focusing on everyone’s individual strengths while maintaining a team spirit.

Nous sommes une équipe jeune et passionnée composée de professionnels avec différentes expertises touchant le milieu de la danse, de la santé (ergothérapie, physiothérapie, orthophoniste, etc.) et de l’éducation. Co-fondateur et porte-parole du Projet, Luca « Lazylegz » Patuelli (danseur de renommé mondiale et conférencier motivationnel) personnalise notre philosophie des possibilités infinies. Nous valorisons l’adaptation et de la créativité en mettant l’accent sur les forces individuelles de nos élèves tout en conservant un esprit d’équipe où le respect et l’entraide nous unissent.



OUR GOAL

Summer activities are extremely limited for people with special needs due largely to budget restraints. Projet RAD has been contacted by many special needs camps and organizations that are interested in offering our programs this summer.  Unfortunately, many of these organizations simply do not have the financing. We are therefore turning to our incredible network of supporters in attempt to offer summer programs to countless young people with special needs.

Le nombre d’activités estivales disponibles pour les personnes ayant des besoins particuliers est très limité, principalement dûs aux contraintes budgétaires. Projet RAD a été contacté par plusieurs organisations et camp spécialisés démontrant un intérêt à bénéficier de nos différents services durant l’été. Malheureusement, plusieurs de ces organisations n’ont simplement pas le budget nécessaire pour fournir de telles activités à leurs jeunes. C’est pourquoi nous nous tournons vers notre incroyable réseau de partenaires afin de nous aider à offrir une programmation d’été au plus grand nombre de jeunes possibles.


With the money raised, we hope to provide:

WORKSHOPS

Projet RAD will offer 8-12 workshops in youth camps and rehabilitation centres.  These classes promote healthy lifestyle habits and the development of a creative spirit, in addition to improving self-esteem and emphasizing strengths.

10 DAY INTENSIVE AT CAMP MASSAWIPPI

For 10-days Projet RAD will instruct daily classes to the campers of Camp Massawippi. The session will end with a choreographed performance in front of all campers, parents, and friends. 

HIP-HOP DAY

Projet RAD will host a full day of inclusive hip-hop activities.  All events will be free and will include dance lessons, graffiti tutorials, DJ booths and more!

The aim of Hip-Hop Day is to educate people about hip-hop culture through fun and accessible activities.


Grâce à l’argent amassé, nous projetons offrir :

ATELIERS

Projet RAD offrira 8 à 12 ateliers dans divers camps et centres de réadaptation. Ces ateliers promouvoient de saines habitudes de vie et le développement d’un esprit créatif, en plus d’améliorer l’estime de soi et de mettre en valeur les forces de chacun.

10 JOURS INTENSIFS AU CAMP MASSAWIPPI

Pendant 10 jours, l’équipe du Projet RAD enseignera des classes hebdomadaires aux  campeurs du Camp Massawippi. Cette session intensive se terminera par un spectacle devant l’ensemble des campeurs, parents et amis.

JOURNÉE SPÉCIALE (HIP HOP DAY)

Projet RAD organisera une journée complète d’activités inclusives. L’événement sera gratuit et permettra à tous de danser, apprendre à créer des graffitis, découvrir l’art d’être un « dj » et plus encore.

L’objectif de cette journée spéciale est de faire connaitre la culture hip hop à travers des activités amusantes et accessibles.



**By donating to our cause, you are helping us get one step closer to our goal! In addition to our endless gratitude, you can also claim one of 6 unique rewards! 

Even if our goal is not met, 100% of the funds will be put towards Projet RAD summer programming.

**En effectuant un don pour notre cause, vous nous aidez à nous rapprocher de notre objectif global. En plus de notre gratitude infinie, vous pouvez également réclamer un des six formidables récompenses.  

***Pour la version française pour des récompenses, consultez le bas de cette page.

Advenant le cas où notre objectif total ne soit pas atteint, l’ensemble des fonds amassés seront tout de même utilisés pour la programmation d’été du Projet RAD.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute right now, it doesn't mean that you can't help! You can still support by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

UNE AUTRE FAÇON D’AIDER

Si vous n’êtes pas dans la mesure de contribuer financièrement, cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas nous donner un coup de pouce! Vous pouvez nous montrer votre support en utilisant les outils de partage Indiegogo afin de faire circuler notre message! 


RÉCOMPENSES -version française

$10.00 – Votre nom sera inscrit sur notre « mur des célébrités » réunissant tous les contributeurs de la campagne. Cette mural sera affichée dans le bureau du projet RAD et votre nom sera mentionné sur nos réseaux sociaux.

$25.00 – Un bracelet « Pas d’excuses, pas de limites » et une mention sur notre « mur des célébrités »

$75.00 – Une carte postale de remerciement, signée par Luca “Lazylegz” Patuelli et l’équipe RAD, ainsi qu’un bracelet et votre nom affiché sur le « mur des célébrités » dans le bureau du projet RAD.

$150.00 - Un t-shirt « Pas d’excuses pas de limites »,  noir et mauve édition limitée, un bracelet et votre nom affiché sur le « mur des célébrités » dans le bureau du projet RAD.

$200.00 - Deux billets et deux accès VIP (accès en arrière-scène pour rencontrer les danseurs) pour un spectacle de hip hop avec les danseurs du projet RAD à Montreal.  * S’il vous plaît noter: cet événement aura lieu à la fin du mai ou au début de juin à Montréal. Transport non inclus.

$500.00 – Classe exclusive avec nul autre que Luca “Lazylegz” Patuelli pour deux personnes.  Autographes et période de questions après le cours.  * S’il vous plaît noter: la date provisoire de cet événement est le 6 septembre. Nous vous contacterons pour vous transmettre tous les détails.

Projet RAD will offer 8-12
workshops in youth camps and rehabilitation centres.  These classes promote healthy lifestyle
habits and the development of a creative spirit, in addition to improving
self-esteem and emphasizing strengths.
10 DAY INTENSIVE
AT CAMP MASSAWIPPI
For 10-days Projet RAD will
instruct daily classes to the campers of Camp Massawippi. The session will end
with a choreographed performance in front of all campers, parents, and
friends.  
HIP-HOP DAY 
Projet RAD will host a full
day of inclusive hip-hop activities.  All
events will be free and will include dance lessons, graffiti tutorials, DJ
booths and more!
The aim of Hip-Hop Day is to
educate people about hip-hop culture through fun and accessible activities.

Grâce
à l’argent amassé, nous projetons offrir :

ATELIERS
Projet RAD offrira 8 à 12 ateliers dans divers camps
et centres de réadaptation. Ces ateliers promouvoient de saines habitudes de vie
et le développement d’un esprit créatif, en plus d’améliorer l’estime de soi et
de mettre en valeur les forces de chacun. 

10 JOURS INTENSIFS AU CAMP MASSAWIPPI 
Pendant 10 jours, l’équipe du Projet RAD enseignera
des classes hebdomadaires aux  campeurs du
Camp Massawippi. Cette session intensive se terminera par un spectacle devant
l’ensemble des campeurs, parents et amis. 

JOURNÉE SPÉCIALE (HIP HOP DAY)
Projet RAD organisera une journée complète d’activités
inclusives. L’événement sera gratuit et permettra à tous de danser, apprendre à
créer des graffitis, découvrir l’art d’être un « dj » et plus encore.


L’objectif de cette journée spéciale est de faire
connaitre la culture hip hop à travers des activités amusantes et accessibles.




**By donating to
our cause, you are helping us get one step closer to our goal! In addition to
our endless gratitude, you can also claim one of 6 unique rewards!  
Even if our goal
is not met, 100% of the funds will be put towards Projet RAD summer
programming.
**En effectuant un don pour notre
cause, vous nous aidez à nous rapprocher de notre objectif global. En plus de
notre gratitude infinie, vous pouvez également réclamer un des six formidables
récompenses.  

***Pour la version française pour des récompenses, consultez le bas de cette page.
Advenant le cas où notre objectif
total ne soit pas atteint, l’ensemble des fonds amassés seront tout de même
utilisés pour la programmation d’été du Projet RAD.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can't contribute
right now, it doesn't mean that you can't help! You can still support by using
the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
UNE AUTRE FAÇON D’AIDER
Si vous n’êtes pas dans la mesure de contribuer
financièrement, cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas nous donner un coup
de pouce! Vous pouvez nous montrer votre support en utilisant les outils de
partage Indiegogo afin de faire circuler notre message! 



RÉCOMPENSES -version française
$10.00 – Votre nom sera inscrit sur notre « mur des célébrités » réunissant tous les contributeurs de la campagne. Cette mural sera affichée dans le bureau du projet RAD et votre nom sera mentionné sur nos réseaux sociaux.
$25.00 – Un bracelet « Pas d’excuses, pas de limites » et une mention sur notre « mur des célébrités »
$75.00 – Une carte postale de remerciement, signée par Luca “Lazylegz” Patuelli et l’équipe RAD, ainsi qu’un bracelet et votre nom affiché sur le « mur des célébrités » dans le bureau du projet RAD.
$150.00 - Un t-shirt « Pas d’excuses pas de limites »,  noir et mauve édition limitée, un bracelet et votre nom affiché sur le « mur des célébrités » dans le bureau du projet RAD.
$200.00 - Deux billets et deux accès VIP (accès en arrière-scène pour rencontrer les danseurs) pour un spectacle de hip hop avec les danseurs du projet RAD à Montreal.  * S’il vous plaît noter: cet événement aura lieu à la fin du mai ou au début de juin à Montréal. Transport non inclus.
$500.00 – Classe exclusive avec nul autre que Luca “Lazylegz” Patuelli pour deux personnes.  Autographes et période de questions après le cours.  * S’il vous plaît noter: la date provisoire de cet événement est le 6 septembre. Nous vous contacterons pour vous transmettre tous les détails.

story:
Short Summary

The Boutique Theatre is located on the second floor of a heritage building in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico.  Once upon a time it was a restaurant designed around a large cluster of trees covered with a palapa roof. Well....

The tree died.

The roof leaks.

And the street noise is intolerable.


We need a new roof. And tree removal. And soundproofing. Our audiences like the shows but are uncomfortable with the trees and the street noise and the rain. 
We were forced out of our previous location where, over the years, TripAdvisor rated us as one of the top entertainment venues in Puerto Vallarta.
Help us reclaim that status.  The shows are terrific but the accommodations are not.  A new design eliminates the trees, soundproofs the theatre and provides a new roof.  All we need is $38,500 to complete this project and  and provide a venue our actors deserve.  Please help us!

What people have to say about the Boutique Theatre

" I have been an enthusiastic supporter of the 'Boutique Theatre' since seeing 'The Best little Whore House in Texas' in 2012 when I was amazed at the quality of community theatre that Ken and Karrie Sebryk had coordinated and produced in Puerto Vallarta. Witnessing the growing and expanding excitement with which the theatre was received was a glowing testament to the professionalism and dedication of the actors, directors, support staff and producers of everything that was staged at 'Boutique'. The longtime commitment that the Sebryk's have given to live theatre in Vallarta has borne continual successes that can only be ascribed to hard work, sweat, frustration, fun, giggles, laughs and camaraderie.  How can anyone not want to be a part of such a worthwhile endeavour! " Ted Fitzgerald, London, On.

“Congratulations on the renovation. When I come down in January I will definitely want to contribute toward the theatre. I so appreciate your commitment to the theatre and all your hard work and heart. All the best to you, dear colleagues.” Dana Zeller-Alexis, New York, NY

“John and I have totally enjoyed our visits to and participation in your wonderful Boutique Theater. It is a marvelous place where one can develop talents and interests that have been previously pushed aside because of work commitments and family responsibilities. What a pleasure it was to get to know and work with the talented theater community. We have enjoyed all the performances and love the fact that Mexicans and expats work side by side to produce such a variety of shows. There is no doubt that the theater is providing a valuable place for all to develop talents, build a theatrical community and enhance beautiful Puerto Vallarta. You enrich your community for the enjoyment of all. Thank you Boutique Theater.” John & Jo-Ann Reil, Teacapan, Mexico

“The whole experience was very beneficial for the students. Ken and Karrie gave them an opportunity to showcase their talents in a completely new and exciting environment. They were understandably nervous and excited about the day, but they all loved it.”
Heather Fenton, Teacher Colegio Americao, Puerto Vallarta

“The experience Harkness Institute has had with the Boutique Theater is nothing less than magical. The Sebryks produced “Teahouse of the August Moon” with the seniors of our school –– players who previously were untrained and who had never been on stage before. They worked them, rehearsed them, and brought them to a professional level. The end result was a memorable performance for both the school and the community. Our kids were transformed! We are in awe of the abilities of the Sebryks and what they have brought to Puerto Vallarta” David Bender, President, Harkness Institute, Nuevo Vallarta, Mexico

Enjoying the show on a dry day!

story:
Hi ! My name is Koncept,

Real Name Paul Guintu. For 12 years, I have been highly involved in the Sacramento dance community.  During my 12 years of dance experience, I have learned and trained in many different styles of dance including Hip Hop, Krump, Popping and Freestyle. I have directed the award winning crews “The GoodFellas” and junior team "The WiseGuys."

As an individual, I have taught at over 5 dance studios over the span of 6 years and recently created an all freestyle dance training program called, “Unlock your style,” a program that guides new and experienced dancers to develop their individual style. In addition to teaching I've also produced a dance battle league, Legends In The Making, in Sacramento providing this city workshops from dancers all over the country and provided a place to express their passions.

I am super excited to finally open a location were all dancers in Sacramento can come together, do what they love, connect, learn the culture and grow. 

A center by dancers, for dancers.

_________________________________

Hi! I'm Lantern

Real name Emanuel Simmons II, dancing since 6 years old I have experience teaching at studios, colleges, and private classes. During my 10 years of performance experience, I was the WILCO winner of the Tops in Blue Worldwide talent competition. Apart of the world famous Funny Bones Crew, I've participated in many dance battles, competitions, and involved myself in the Sacramento dance community. Originally from Greensboro, NC, I moved to Sacramento shortly after my time in the military and quickly fell in love with the spirit of the Sacramento scene. I am extremely happy to be able to open a dance center to invest my knowledge and experience into an already growing dance community.

Come build with us!

_________________________________

Together

with  over 20 years experience , in Choreography, freestyle and dance instruction, Paul and Manny aim to  provide an atmosphere that educates on the art of movement, interpretation of music, and expression of self, But also, encourages an individual to constantly work on self improvement.

__________________________________

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a prospected building with 3,773 SF, 2 large rooms and 2 small rooms.

We need 15,000 for:

  • Remodeling
  • Mirrors
  • Sound Systems
  • Signage

 

Everything we need to transform this building into The Foundry Dance Studio!!

 

Check out the great perks you get for backing this campaign!!

FDC (Foundry Dance Center) T-shirts, Free workshops, Unlimited class passes for the month, and get your name on a plaque full of supporters that will be hung in our center!

_______________________________

Opening and maintaining a dance center can be very challenging! We plan to use the knowledge and skills we have learned over the years to provide a center with classes that fit you.

We have a great line up of instructors that have remarkable teaching capabilities and a heavy impact on the Sacramento dance community. Instructors who have, planned / executed youth events, hosted weekly open sessions, provided training programs to students of all skills / ages, and directed multiple successful dance teams. Together, we can create an environment where dancers can connect, future dancers can start their journey, and we all can grow as a community!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty other ways to contribute! Please, share this Indiegogo link and spread the word about The Foundry Dance Center! 

FOLLOW US on Instagram  and Facebook!

@FoundryDanceCenter

story:
Short Summary

It is the dream of every playwright to get their work in front of a New York audience, and now we've been given that chance.  Help us to bring My Dear Watson: A Sherlock Holmes Musical to midtown Manhattan!

What We Need & What You Get

Between our production fee, sets, costumes, personnel, travel costs, and more, this is an expensive endeavor, and we need your help.  No amount is too small, and we appreciate all contributions.  You can contribute in any denominations you see fit, but here are some ways of us saying thank you for your generosity:

  • Mrs. Hudson donors: Contribution of at least $10.  You will receive recognition in the program and on the official website.
  • Lestrade donors: Contribution of at least $25. You will recieve recognition in the program and on the official website AND a page of the script signed by the playwright.
  • Watson donors: Contribution of at least $50. You will recieve recognition in the program and on the official website AND a page of the script signed by the playwright AND a poster signed by the entire cast and crew.
  • Holmes donors: Contribution of at least $100. You will recieve recognition in the program and on the official website AND a page of the script signed by the playwright AND a poster signed by the entire cast and crew AND a sample soundtrack with selected songs from the musical.

Thank you in advance for your support, and please share our campaign!

story:
What's The Story?

Who could pretend they never lied?

Built around a fictional TV show called "The Kaspar Hauser Show", Who Are You? investigates the lives (and lies!) of three imposters who all became infamous at the dawn of the 21st century: a catfish, a chameleon, and a piano man. Their goal? To win the coveted “Anonymity Pass”: the chance to start over again with a new, guilt-free identity. But though all the world’s a stage, no one can remain anonymous forever... Who will you vote for? The power is in your hands!

What Do We Need (& Why)?

We want to raise $10,000 to cover the following fees:

  • Rehearsal space;
  • Production costs (set/props, costumes, marketing, etc.)
  • Cast & creative team. 

In return for your generosity, the perks you could get include:

  • A personalized "Thank You" email;
  • A program signed by the cast & creative team;
  • Two (2) free tickets to a select performance of the show in NYC (travel and accommodations NOT included);
  • Your name in the program;
  • A special evening of drinks with the cast & creative team! 

What's The Impact?

Following a London showcase and a stage reading at the Dramatists Guild Fund in NYC, we are thrilled Who Are You? was selected to be presented as part of MITF: Summer 2017 and really want to make the most out of this exciting opportunity. However, producing theatre in New York City can be quite expensive, so we need your help to tell this powerful story. We believe in the potential of our show, and know its subject matter is appealing and extremely relevant to the era we live in. By donating, you will help get a new original musical off the ground, and hopefully make MITF a launching point to whatever the next step is for Who Are You? 

*Please remember: there is no such thing as small donations - every contribution helps!

Other Ways You Can Help...

We know $10,000 is A LOT of money. If you can't donate financially - no worries! Here are other ways you can help spread the word about us and make Who Are You? a success at this year's MITF:

  • SHARE: Tell your friends about us, and share this campaign on Facebook!
  • LIKE: Like us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/WAYMusical)
  • FOLLOW: Follow us on Twitter (@WAYMusical), and on Instagram (@waythemusical17)
  • VISIT&LISTEN: Visit our writers' website and listen to some of the show's song samples (http://chouinardandvest.com/)

Or come and see the show this summer at The WorkShop Theater in NYC! Tickets: $20. Dates TBC. We hope to see you there!

story:
Hello Friends and Colleagues! 
 Signalling a very exciting beginning to 2016, I have scheduled a staged reading of my new play "Gunbarrel, Texas" on Feb. 2 at 8:00 pm at the Hudson Theater in Hollywood. The play is unofficially subtitled "Where Brokeback Mountain Meets Waiting for Godot.....Sorta". I will read the role of Henry and Adam Wylie, who you will recognize from the television series "Picket Fences" as well as guest appearances on shows such as "Judging Amy", "Monk", "CSI Miami" and others, will read the part of Curtis. Adam also appeared in the 2002 Broadway revival of Stephen Sondheim's "Into the Woods". Also graciously lending her support to the staged reading will be Lyn Alicia Henderson who will read stage directions. Lyn regularly appeared on "ER" and has guest appeared on numerous other series including "Seinfeld", "Knight Rider", "Boston Legal", "Without A Trace", and others. The reading is being directed by Joy Hooper who recently directed the very successful production of "Detroit 67" at the Los Angeles Theater Center (L.A.T.C.). Casting for the reading has been by Bruce Newberg, CSA. 
 This will be the first, professionally produced, presentation of the play and is, I hope, the first step towards a full production. The script has been submitted to several theaters in the US and the UK. Though none have so far opted to produce the play the writing I believe is in good shape. And while most theaters do not take the time to communicate with playwrights who have submitted manuscripts, in a couple of instances I did receive responses from theaters who regretted that they were unable to offer a production. For example, the Soho Theatre in London, after reading the play, sent me their writer's report which, among four pages of overwhelmingly positive remarks, described the play as being "a complex, intelligent and sensitive play, written with a strong sense of what theatre should explore, and how it should go about doing so." In addition the Literary Officer for the Traverse Theatre in Edinburgh, Scotland wrote me saying that the play was "...by turns tender and merciless and beautifully written. Your voice is very much your own and this originality stands out brilliantly." These comments and other similarly powerful and supportive comments from other theater professionals are what have kept me going. 
 My life long dream has been to work professionally as a writer and actor. A very long and winding road has brought me to this point, finally. But in order to offset the $4,500 which this reading has cost, all of which has come out of my own pocket, at the urging of friends and colleagues, I have undertaken this crowdfunding campaign through Indiegogo. Any support you can provide - and no amount is too large or too small - would be greatly appreciated. Your generosity and support will never be forgotten. Thanks much, and On With The Show!
